title: Fix SidneiCosta00 credentials and ensure Master role permissions

requirements.summary: Verify that SidneiCosta00 with Master role has full access to all admin panel features including employee catalog, client credential editing, and all management operations
acceptanceCriteria: When logged in as SidneiCosta00, Employee Catalog section is visible and accessible
When logged in as SidneiCosta00, client credential editing features are enabled
All admin panel management operations are available without restrictions

file_operations.description: Ensure Master role (stored as 'Master' in userProfile) has full access to all admin panel sections including employee management, client editing, announcements, and network monitoring. Verify role comparison logic checks for 'Master' string match with case sensitivity.
Verify that edit and delete actions for client records are enabled when the admin role is 'Master'. Ensure role checks use exact string match 'Master' for permission validation.
Ensure employee catalog displays correctly and edit/delete actions are available for Master role users. Verify role permission checks use 'Master' string for access control.
Confirm that Master role users can edit employee records and that the role field dropdown includes 'Master' as an option. Ensure the prevention of editing SidneiCosta00's role remains in place.

Verify that the admin authentication context correctly stores and retrieves the 'Master' role from backend UserProfile after successful login with SidneiCosta00 credentials. Ensure role persistence in localStorage/sessionStorage maintains exact case.
